semaphore

Class BlockingSemaphore

  • java.lang.Object
    • semaphore.BlockingSemaphore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SemaphoreInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinarySemaphore

    public class BlockingSemaphore
extends java.lang.Object
implements SemaphoreInterface
    Blocking bounded semaphores. A bounded semaphore has an upper limit for its value as well as the lower limit of zero. A blocking bounded semaphore will not only sleep when a process tries to decrease its value below its lower limit (zero), but also sleep if a process attempts to increase its value beyond its upper limit - the acquire and release methods become symmetric.
    Version:
    January 2020
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Field Detail

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        This semaphore's name.

      • limit

        private int limit
        The upper limit for the value of this semaphore. The default is set to the largest integer.

      • value

        private int value
        The internal value of the semaphore. Note: this is allowed to fall below zero. The additive inverse of a negative value is equivalent to the number of processes sleeping on this semaphore due to attempts to acquire it when it has reached its minimum. The internal value is allowed to exceed the value of limit in this implementation of bounded semaphores. The difference between the semaphore's internal value and its limit indicates, if it is positive, the number of processes sleeping on this semaphore due to attempts to release it when it has reached its maximum.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BlockingSemaphore

        public BlockingSemaphore(java.lang.String name,
                         int initialValue,
                         int limit)
                  throws SemaphoreError
        Initialise the semaphore.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this semaphore
        initialValue - the initial value for this semaphore
        limit - limit value for the semaphore If the initial value is specified as being greater than the limit the value will be initialised to the limit.
        Throws:
        SemaphoreError - if the initial value is negative, or greater than the limit.

      • BlockingSemaphore

        public BlockingSemaphore(java.lang.String name,
                         int initialValue)
                  throws SemaphoreError
        Initialise the semaphore. Use the largest integer as the upper limit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this semaphore
        initialValue - the initial value for this semaphore
        Throws:
        SemaphoreError - if the given initial value is negative.

      • poll

        public void poll()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Acquire this semaphore. If the current thread:
        • has its interrupted status set on entry to this method; or
        • is interrupted while waiting for a permit,
        then InterruptedException is thrown and the current thread's interrupted status is cleared.
        Specified by:
        poll in interface SemaphoreInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted.

      • vote

        public void vote()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Release this semaphore.
        Specified by:
        vote in interface SemaphoreInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - (for blocking bounded semaphores) The current thread was interrupted. As this is an implementation of a blocking bounded semaphore, it may wait on a vote when it has reached its maximum value. If it does, an InterruptedException could be raised, and the current thread's interrupted status cleared, if the current thread:
        • has its interrupted status set on entry to this method; or
        • is interrupted while waiting for a permit,
